Reviews.Title: Nice TV if you need a small HDTV set
Reviews.Author: terpfan1980 "Barry"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV compliments of the big V telco/data company.  The big V telco promised customers that signed up for their Fiber Optic to the home service triple play bundle a free Sharp Aquos TV.  Apparently their offer was very popular and lots of customers like me signed up during their promotion.I note that this particular Sharp LCD TV doesn't make mention of the Aquos model/brand, tough it is a very nice HDTV set if you are in need of a smaller set.  As a kitchen/dining room set, or perhaps as a TV for use in children's rooms this Sharp model (LC19SB25U) would seem to be a very nice choice.  It delivers crisp and sharp (no pun intended) pictures with it's 720p capability.  (1080i or 1080p would downconvert nicely on this set)  In my case, this TV serves me well for watching TV a few feet over on the corner of the desk in my den/playroom type area.  It offers me the opportunity to watch TV programming while using my regular HDTV to play video games on, on most nites serving up the nightly baseball game :-)The remote control is adequate, and the available connections are also quite adequate (including an HDMI port and PC input port, features not always included on smaller LCD TVs).  Documentation included with this TV is complete and thorough without being too confusing or hard to use.In most cases a larger TV may be priced within range of this Sharp LCD TV, and you may find the larger size is more important than the input ports or other impressive features found on this Sharp LCD TV.  Research the features you'd gain or lose along the way before buying just to be sure you aren't making a bad decision.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: A. McIntire
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews here, and checking this model (and others) out at brick & mortar stores, we decided to buy it despite the negative comments on the sound/volume.  As others here have noted the picture is quite nice, but more important we did not have any problems with the volume.  We have not yet turned it up over maybe 1/3 of the total, and it is plenty loud enough for our living room.  Granted, we are not vacuuming while watching TV, but we do have a couple of rambunctious kids, and the TV is plenty loud enough with them running around.------------------------------(later)Well, some videos (disc & tape) seem to need the volume turned all the way up to hear, but most things are just fine at 1/4 to 1/3 volume level.  Don't know what makes those videos different, but they consistently need the volume boost, while others never need it.  Regular TV (over the air or via cable) never needs the boost.

Reviews.Title: Very good HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. Renfroe "metal9966"
Reviews.Content: This Sharp LCD HDTV Is great. Has a super clear picture... works flawlessly in 480P mode with my Nintendo Wii and Dvd. The built in digital tuner was able to pick up about 15 Digital HDTV Channels using a standard indoor rabbit ears antenna. I am also very impressed with the black level and contrast. Will also connect to a pc in in full 1360x768 resolution. This tv also has an optical out for connecting a dolby digital 5.1 tuner. It amazing to get True DD 5.1 surround sound from shows such as CSI Miami. The built in speakers are only 2 watt. So I recomend use of external speakers with this set. the resolution of 720P is perfect for this size HDTV. 480p sources such as dvds and wii across the component cables scale very well and look great. I would highly recomend this set to anyone looking for a high quality Small size HDTV set.

Reviews.Title: Returned the set. Couldn't hear it.
Reviews.Author: Gerald H. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I was hyped about this new model. I paid top dollar from my local electronics store since I needed a new tv for my kitchen ($459). I wanted the new tuner that would pick up all the signals after the changover next febuary. Well I hooked it up and thought it was everything I hoped, super clear screen. The problem is even with the audio on full it seems like it's on low. I returned it for a Toshiba whick had just as nice of picture and nice volume. What good is a tv if you can't hear it? Unless your not using the tv's speakers I would avoid this set.

Reviews.Title: Where's the Volume?
Reviews.Author: Adam Petrone "Adam"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this set and love the picture but there is no volume to talk about. I had to buy a powered external speaker for it, at full volume it can barely be heard. Sharp might have the screen down but they need alot of help with the audio. Only buy this set if you plan on using external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Good solid TV
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and configure.  We didn't notice the sound issues that other reviewers have mentioned; perhaps because we are using it in a bedroom.No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: M. Plachko "Marty"
Reviews.Content: After having one of these TV's for about six months, I purchased 3 more for my kids for Christmas, and they all are working great.  Excellent TV for both Comcast Cable or a digital TV antenna. It has a nice built in signal meter to peak the antenna signals. HDTV has great quality. I use one in my small office on my desk, and my Jayco camper trailer in the summer. Great color setup and sound quality for a small TV. I have nothing bad to say! I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Sound is Sufficient, Great Price for HDTV
Reviews.Author: Burgmicester
Reviews.Content: The picture is just as the Company name implies - Sharp.  The color is very good, the picture can be seen from all angles.  The sound is more than sufficient for our purposes; the TV is placed in the kitchen.  If there is a lot of noise around, you will have to turn the volume up nearly all the way.  I was a little surprised by the weakness of the speakers.  However, that said, I was purchasing for a specific purpose and it fills that need very well.  It is hooked directly to the cable box through the HDMI port and it was a breeze to install.  I do question why the screen is slightly tilted past the vertical with the top ever so slightly forward, however, I do not see where that makes a difference with the picture quality.  With it sitting on the countertop, it might even be helpful. An adjustable stand would have been a nice feature.  The dimensions are especially nice as its vertical dimension is 14.1 inches and allows it to fit nicely under our cabinets.  Based on the price, quality of the picture, and its looks, it is a very nice product.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture But Where's The Sound
Reviews.Author: M. D. Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my wife to watch in the kitchen.  I have it connected to Comcast cable without a digital/HD box and the picture on all channels is great.  However, the sound is another thing.  The digital channels can be set at a reasonable volume, but the analog channels are a whisper at full volume.  Will try a set of power speakers to see if improves the sound on the analog channels.

Reviews.Title: Sharp 19" HDTV
Reviews.Author: B. Wallace
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews on the television before purchasing and am pleased with the unit.  The only disappointment is that Walmart carries the same unit for $50 less than I was able to purchase through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Don't like the sound?  EASILY fixed.
Reviews.Author: Arthur Kimes
Reviews.Content: Many reviews complain about the sound.  The standard speakers/amp aren't very good.  It's hard to put good speakers in a small thin space.  But the fix is easy and inexpensive.Get a 2.1 speakers system (2 powered speakers and a powered sub-woofer).  Something that can be plugged into this TV's headphone jack.  There are many of them on Amazon - I'm using this one - the Logitech S220 2.1 Speaker System.  It not only sounds great, it delivers enough volume for me to listen to the TV when I'm using my very noisy exercise bike.You might be able to fix it for NO cost.  Try the speakers from some old computer you don't use anymore.  So long as they're powered speakers you'll get much higher output than you're getting from the TV now.  (But if you can, get the 2.1 system. A powered sub-woofer makes all the difference).What about the rest of the TV?  I don't have a lot to add to the other reviews. The picture is fine.  Menus are a little tedious but the remote is well laid out.  There's a tremendous amount of fine tuning you can do if you want to tweak the picture - I've never seen so many color options (in the advanced menus).A number of reviews say the picture is a bit on the dim side.  I suppose so but after adjusing it using one of the THX guides on a DVD I think the picture looks about as good as the one on the 37" Panasonic Plasma in my living room.  Anyway, I've had this TV for a few months now and I'm used to the picture now.  Quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: good purchase
Reviews.Author: Amy WV
Reviews.Content: Nice TV.  Don't have any problem with volume as others have complained.  Worked right out of the box.  Nice pic and good sound!

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: Tommy J
Reviews.Content: Great little TV. The picture is excellent. The sound is very good for little speakers. The remote control is very handy and logical.Excellent quality. It has all the connection types, HDMI, S video,RGB and pc connection. Excellent digital reception. If using local external antenna, the antenna should be digital rated.I remember my first TV, an old 19" Admiral that weighed 50+ lbs in a wood cabinet. Wow, what a change! Now we have a LCD Sharp 19" that you can lift with one hand and a fantastic picture with a remote control.

Reviews.Title: SHARP TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas S. Mirley
Reviews.Content: I saw some complaints about this TV before I bought it but had good luck with Sharp. The TV is excellent , both picture and sound are fine. A great set for bedroom or kitchen. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jackie Horvat "jmarie"
Reviews.Content: Sharp LC19SB25U 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTVThis television is just perfect for my home office.  It takes up little space and has a great picture.  Some reviewers complained about the sound, but I have no issues with it.  Great price for a great little TV.

Reviews.Title: Great boob tube
Reviews.Author: A. Kellman "Metalrecords"
Reviews.Content: No compliants..Great set, sharp picture..Lots of input/output options. Spoke to a few tv techs and the Sharp units were highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: Sharp TV not as sharp as advertized
Reviews.Author: T. Lovell
Reviews.Content: I can't say I wasn't warned, several previous reviewers reported that the sound volume was not adequate.  I didn't believe it as we have a slightly older model with a silver grille surround on both sides that sounds very good with plenty of volume.  Well, the new model doesn't have the side grilles, and the sound is just not adequate!!  In addition, with the backlight on full, the picture brightness is not nearly as good as the two year old model.  It is sad to see that Sharp's two years of additional development results in a dimmer and tinny sounding replica!  Ted

Reviews.Title: No HDMI PC/Mac support?
Reviews.Author: Ian Edward "cyber pilot"
Reviews.Content: When I paid for this 19" SHARP, I asked if it supported HDMI input from a PC/Mac to serve as a high-resolution monitor. Despite being extremely specific with my question, I was apparently lied to and purchased an LC display that DOES NOT support HDMI input from a computer.While the LC-19SB25U supports A/V input from an HDMI cable, it refuses to calibrate or connect with my computer. As a PC/Mac monitor it only supports VGA input which is NOT high-definition. A standard VGA-out tube television can do the same thing for $30.To compare, I also own a 27" Ölevia HDTV. It cost less than $400, supports HDMI input from virtually all sources (including my computer), can be updated with firmware and has superior sound and image quality. While the Ölevia may not be true 16:9, it supports 1080p and is offers about twice the screen size for the same or less money.I absolute do not recommend the SHARP LC-19SB25U as a monitor or television. Its too quiet to work in a kitchen or office, and does not work as an HD monitor.

Reviews.Title: A fine little Television
Reviews.Author: J. A Winters "jwint3768"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV for my home office and felt a 19 inch set would be more than adequate.  We own a 36" Sharp for our downstairs family room which is now about 3 1/2 years old.  We love its picture and quality so I looked for a Sharp if possible.  I found this set at Wal-Mart for $168.00 which I thought was a good price.  All I did was unpack it, attach the coaxial cable and plug it in. I haven't fussed with any adjustments.  The sound is perfectly fine for my 12' by 9' foot office. I think this set is great for this kind of location or in a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the Money!
Reviews.Author: H. Mahagoub
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sharp LC-19SB25U at my local Wal-Mart for $150.00 (a deal that could NOT be passed up!). We had been looking for a tv that would be good for our bedroom. I currently have a Sharp Aquos & love it, but it's not digital ready. We decided to give it to our son for his video watching/gaming & purchase a new one. We have a Samsung in our living room & love it, so decided that we would go w/that in our bedroom, but happen to come across this Sharp on sale at Wal-Mart & purchased it. Most of the LCD tvs we looked at had horrible sound, so we don't care if we need to hook up speakers to it (so far it's great). It's a great looking tv! I have gotten good deals thru Amazon in the past and am happy with them, but this time I got a better deal somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for use with game consoles.
Reviews.Author: Usually Dead
Reviews.Content: Since I just recently purchased my first game console in over 9 years, I knew I would need a TV to hook it up to. I found this set at a local brick'n'mortar retailer, and I was impressed. For the price, this thing is jam-packed with features. 720p HD, inputs for co-axial TV, composite with optional S-video, component RGB, HDMI, and a VGA connector that can take analog video from a computer.The display is lovely, and the 16:9 aspect ratio is perfect on my game console. Though the display is only 19", and the built-in stereo speakers aren't too powerful, neither of these issues is a drawback for me. I use this thing in a bedroom, and I'm never more than six feet away from it. Its display size and volume are perfect for so small a space.What I love best about this TV is that, with its VGA computer-video input, I can switch between using this as a display for my game console and using it as a secondary widescreen monitor for my PC. The display quality somewhat poor by PC standards, but it's plenty good enough for text-based applications like chat programs.I am very happy with this purchase. I highly recommend this TV for anyone who needs a game console display for one or two people in a small room.

Reviews.Title: Sharp LC19SB25U 19" LCD HDTD
Reviews.Author: Keith W. Thompson "kwtkt"
Reviews.Content: Just purchased from Wal Mart today for $178.00. Recommended by sales person and judging from the reviews, I made the right choice.  Setup was easy & fast, documentation easy to follow. Picture is great and may  even get better as I learn to make the adjustments.  Can't go wrong at this price.

Reviews.Title: Everything great but the volume.  Purchased at Wal-Mart for $198!
Reviews.Author: like good deals
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sharp LC-19SB25U at a local Wal-Mart for $198.00 on 4/17/09.  I had been looking for a 19" for my kitchen and was waiting for them to get under $200 and really didn't care about the brand, as long as I was satisified with the reviews.  I was getting close to buying a Coby thru Amazon or a Sanyo at Wal-Mart when I stumbled across this Sharp on sale at Wal-Mart. I bought it and have been happy so far.  I agree with the other reviews regarding the low volume however.  I took my computer speakers and hooked them up and they were much louder than the tv's speakers.  They are just a temporary fix since I plan on buying a nice speaker to mount under the counter alongside the tv.  So for another $20 bucks or so I'll be up to $218, which is still a good deal in my opinion.  It is a nice looking tv!  I have gotten good deals thru Amazon in the past and am happy with them, but this time I got a better deal somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: Sound an obvious issue but otherwise...
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Jones "frescababe"
Reviews.Content: Pleased with product other than sound being too low even when on highest setting.  Cannot hear if the ceiling fan is on (the whoosh of air noise).

Reviews.Title: Sharp LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Joanne Sawyer "BookmarkJo"
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with product.  Bought as a gift and husband loves.  Have no problem with low sound as reported.

Reviews.Title: Sharp LC19SB25U LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Kenneth G. Scott "Kenneth Scott"
Reviews.Content: Picture is quite stunning but there is that sound weakness which fortunately for me I watch from a short distance away (ca. 10') and live alone so nothing distracting going on.  It's tolerable especially considering the inexpensive price.  Setup was easy with well documented instructions.  I suppose one could take audio out to a better sound system.  Overall I'm happy I got it.

Reviews.Title: Good reception
Reviews.Author: Ronald Peterson
Reviews.Content: It worked right out of the box. The default picture had high contrast, but controls allowed that to be fixed.Over the air reception worked well with little interference.The base had to be screwed on with an included hex wrench.Speaker loudness was adequate, but a little more volume would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Sharp 19 inch
Reviews.Author: S. Janneck
Reviews.Content: The sound quality is very good as is the quality of the T.V. Two complaints though, the stand does not swivel and is cheap plastic where the old ones where a metal that would swivel quite easily.  Also, the lag time between changing  channels and the channel appearing on screen is interminable.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE  THIS IS A LEMON!!
Reviews.Author: pognyc "pognyc"
Reviews.Content: After bringing it home I really regretted it because the volume is so LOW,  it is often hard to hear and you can not raise the volume beyond the level of a regular speaking voice.Other than that it was an okay TV EXCEPT,  ONE YEAR TO THE WEEK,  I turn it on this morning and NO PICTURE.  The sound comes on and when I change stations they change but still no picture.I spoke to a tech at 1 800 BE SHARP and they advised me to unplug it for a time which I tried and did not work.I live in NEW YORK CITY and there is NO REPAIR location.  I got the impression there were NO AUTHORIZED repair locations ANYWHERE and the only thing they are willing to do,  even though under warranty,  is ALLOW ME TO SHIP IT BACK  ...AND I EVEN HAVE TO PAY FOR THE SHIPPING TO THEM.I searched on the web and found that a LOT OF PEOPLE are losing the PICTURE in their SHARP FLAT SCREEN LCD TV's. Sharp made good tube TV's,  but I'm afraid the digital age seems to have left them in the dust.My lesson:  NEVER BUY ANOTHER ELECTRONIC APPLIANCE PRODUCED OR SOLD BY SHARP. I'll go for quality and not CHEAPNESS next time...

Reviews.Title: Where is the 720p?
Reviews.Author: Gummi di Milo "precious veeeeeeeeeeeenus"
Reviews.Content: The description of the tv says it is 720p. Yet when I click view mode on the remote it says it is 480i. Is the description on Amazon wrong or is there a way to change it from 480i to 720p? The booklet has no instructions to do this.

Reviews.Title: Not so Sharp tv's
Reviews.Author: tomc
Reviews.Content: I know what you are saying about sound. They used the cheapest they could find. External speakers are a must. For what these junkers cost they should last more than 1 yr. 3 mo. Turned it on yesterday and it turned itself back off immediately. I've owned Sharp tv's since the 80's but they have gone by the way other companies have. Take the quality out so the profit is higher.No more dim sharps for me.

Reviews.Title: It's true, it's not loud
Reviews.Author: gnc123
Reviews.Content: It's true, this TV has sound issues.  Is it loud enough in a quiet bedroom? Yes.  In a noisy area? Maybe not.  I had concerns about the sound because the TV is for my father-in-law who is hard of hearing.  But I realized this short-coming was a blessing - no more hearing his TV from his bedroom.  This TV on max is enough for him to hear. (For some reason the speakers don't hiss at max like other TV's). But sometimes with the old TV a loud movie would come on and it could be heard in the great room.  No more of that with this TV!The strong feature of this TV is its picture quality.  If your hearing is fine and if used in quiet area, the sound is adequate.  It is pathetic though of Sharp not to spend a few more dollars on some better speakers.

Reviews.Title: Best 19" TV
Reviews.Author: Roxy "Roxy"
Reviews.Content: We returned a 15" Polaroid TV because the sound was so tinny it hurt our ears.  We bought this 19" Sony instead because the frame around it is so sleek it fit in the small cabinet shelf that no other 19" TV fit into.  It was easy to set up, the picture is beautiful, the sound/volume is perfect. Pretty good view from side angles.  Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Crappy experience
Reviews.Author: Steven K. Lee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this TV set due to the reputation of the sharp name. We made the purchase in June of 2009 and the tv has a one year warranty. Trouble is the company wants us to: 1) come up with the original receipt. Well I lost that unfortunately and asked them for the info I provided them via the online warranty registration. (for those that do not know even if you keep original receipts most stores use thermal paper in the registers which blackens and makes them illedgible after a short time)2) PAY for the shipping and insurance to get the piece of crap back to them. (I think this is really poor considering I bought it in good faith and it is not my fault it is defective)3) if they "deem that it was not packaged "properly" you won't be covered and there is a $50 evaluation fee4) this model must be sent back to the factory for repairsOn a different note the sound quality is really crap we hooked it up to our stereo so we could HEAR it in the first place

Reviews.Title: Garbage from Sharp
Reviews.Author: CMS
Reviews.Content: Bought two. Both emit crackling sounds on or off. Suspect cheap capacitors or speakers. Picture quality is poor.AVOID this rubbish from Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Terrible TV
Reviews.Author: L. Baldassarre
Reviews.Content: We got 2 of these to use as monitors for video production and both of them looked awful.  The image was noisy and blurry.  We tried different settings, different kinds of cables etc and nothing made a discernable difference.  We used Y-Pr-Pb component cables, S-video and composite.  Believe it or not, the composite cables looked better than the component!  I suggested we take a look at a 19" AOC which is currently even cheaper than this one.  We hooked it up to one of our cameras and it was a night and day difference.  The SD mode on the AOC looks better than the HD mode on this Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Poor sound quality for a Sony flat screen TV
Reviews.Author: Rackish
Reviews.Content: This TV would've been perfect but for the poor sound quality.  I plan on buying computer speakers for this TV just to boost the poor sound quality.

Reviews.Title: NOT the Perfect Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Jessica W "Jess"
Reviews.Content: I read review after review of this TV and bought it with the intention of putting it in my bedroom. Didn't even take it out of the box...that's how small it was. So unfortunately I can't comment on the quality, but I will say that Sharp or no Sharp...too much money for not enough TV!
